text: welcome to daily video vocabulary a dose
of daily new English phrases and words
brought to you by let's talk podcast
calm
hello English learners welcome to daily
video vocabulary episode 70 in today's
episode I have a new word for you
a face let's find out what it means and
how you can use it in your daily
conversation a face there are many
things that you might have done in the
past which you would never like to
remember and just want to forget the
word efface basically means to make
something disappear or to wipe out so
when you try to erase something from
your mind it means you are facing it it
also means to make oneself appear
insignificant by not drawing any
attention to yourself you can efface
things that are not physical likely
facing memories and feelings for example
when someone hurts you you choose to
forgive and forget
just to face all the bad memories when
physical elements like an old coin is
effaced it means it is worn out as the
word efface shows the action of erasing
or wiping out something it is a verb
okay now that you know what if face
means let's take a look at some example
sentences to see how you can use it in
your daily conversation
example one after returning from a bad
day at work
Michels anger was effaced when she saw
her children playing games on the laptop
example till the college students used
scrub brushes and white spray paint to
face the graffiti on the wall example
three to face the bad memories of her
marriage Lisa left the town and migrated
to Canada to start life afresh after her
divorce example 4 while reading the
storybook the innocent child asked her
mother mom do you think good deeds can a
face hour passed since example 5 a
regular coat of Teflon prevents the
surface of the car's paint from effacing
and keeps it sparkling you example 6 all
high-end cosmetic brands have introduced
beauty bombs in an attempt to face
blemishes and scars on the face example
7 Peter couldn't efface the guilt from
his conscience after cheating on his
wife he kept thinking about it
example eight Samantha had to undergo a
plastic surgery to face all the burnt
marks caused by the mishap that had
taken place in her kitchen example 9
after committing the crime
the murderer faced all the evidence
leaving the investigation team clueless
and helpless that's the end of today's
episode is there anything from your past
that you would like to efface kindly
share your experiences in the comment
box below this video thank you for
watching us do watch all the episodes of
daily video vocabulary to better your
English language skills do subscribe to
our Channel and stay updated with all
the latest lessons I will see you again
tomorrow with a new word or a phrase
till then
bye and take care
